item.title: Tailing a log file and Running an Application at the Same Time
item.description: A quick tip this, but a useful one. You can tail a log file in the background while running a script in the foreground. So for example, I frequently execute the following commands: 1. tail -f /var/log/httpd.log & /etc/init.d/apache restart 2. (The log file will spool onto the terminal as Apache is restarted.) 3.
